author: daTO
title: #24 El sacerdote Antonio Casado: "El obispo de CÃ¡diz me obligÃ³ a donar fundaciones de caridad para controlar el dinero"
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#24](c24#c-24) Si hubiese transparencia real bastarÃ­a con ver quÃ© notarios son los que firman las donaciones y ultimas voluntades que se destinan a la iglesia.
Si hubiese transparencia real y total, con herramientas de datamining y BI sacas a la luz en cero coma toda la corrupciÃ³n endÃ©mica en este paÃ­s. Por eso los mÃ¡s corruptos son los primeros interesados en que no haya nada a la vista, atesorar ellos lo delicado (como la documentaciÃ³n en manos de la FundaciÃ³n Nazional Francisco Franco) y destruir documentaciÃ³n pÃºblica (como hizo la Botella durante dÃ­as antes de entrar Carmena). Incluso misteriosamente se inundan e incendian archivos "conflictivos" de distintas instituciones antes de abrir juicios, y en pleno siglo XXI resulta que no tenemos digitalizado, accesible y con copia externalizada toda esa documentaciÃ³n tan delicada
Desde los templarios, los Borgia, el banco Ambrosiano, etc., son tantos los casos que indican que su reino sÃ­ es de este mundo, que levanta el Ã¡nimo ver que todavÃ­a quedan personas dentro de esta instituciÃ³n que creen en algunos pilares Ã©ticos. Abogo por mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n directa, concreta, constante, para que poco a poco los sinvergÃ¼enzas queden cada vez mÃ¡s arrinconados en una sociedad cada vez mÃ¡s autocrÃ­tica.
[#1](c1#c-1) Â¿Tantos casos? Te has tenido que remontar a 1982 (Banco Ambrosiano), Los Borgia (siglo XVI) y ni mÃ¡s ni menos que los templarios (siglo XII) para poner ejemplos. Te pregunto Â¿realmente es algo habitual o es anecdÃ³tico teniendo en cuenta la extensiÃ³n en el tiempo y en el espacio que tiene la Iglesia?
[#23](c23#c-23) Pero el tema de las inmatriculaciones puede ser polÃ©mico pero no constituye corrupciÃ³n. Desde 1863 las instituciones pÃºblicas y la Iglesia tienen la capacidad de inmatricular por certificaciÃ³n, un sistema especial para inscribir aquellos bienes de los que no es posible mostrar un tÃ­tulo de propiedad, por ejemplo, por su antigÃ¼edad o por razones histÃ³ricas.
PodrÃ­as poner en cambio lo del robo de bebÃ©s y su posterior adopciÃ³n. AhÃ­ tocarÃ­as un tema algo mÃ¡s actual. En ese caso sÃ­ podrÃ­amos hablar de corrupciÃ³n.
Que miren en la fundaciÃ³n Las Edades del Hombre y en la Junta de Castilla y Leon y verÃ¡n el lodazal de mierda que hay
[#10](c10#c-10) [#17](c17#c-17) Buff... Me contesto solo:
https://www.google.com/search?q="las edades del hombre corrupciÃ³n"
[#2](c2#c-2) Hasta que te informas y resulta que te obligan a hacer chorrocientos trÃ¡mites y papeleos, ademÃ¡s de visitas a parroquias buscando tu registro. Este coÃ±azo echa a mucha gente para atrÃ¡s.
Ya que en Hacienda se integran tan bien con la iglesia para la X del IRPF, a ver cuÃ¡ndo ponen otra casilla al lado de "QUIERO APOSTATAR".
[#4](c4#c-4) [#2](c2#c-2) https://www.google.com/amp/s/cadenaser.com/nacional/2023/04/06/apostatar-en-espana-sin-datos-oficiales-y-con-un-proceso-relativamente-sencillo-cadena-ser/%3foutputType=amp gracias a los 2, al menos me habÃ©is hecho replantearme la necesidad de intentarlo.
[#4](c4#c-4) Es mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil de lo que piensas:
https://apostatar.wordpress.com/como-apostatar-informacion-practica/
[#4](c4#c-4) lo hacen tan difÃ­cil que al final, lo mÃ¡s rÃ¡pido es ir a su templo y mearse en la pila del agua, a ver si asÃ­ aceleran los trÃ¡mites,
[#22](c22#c-22) Ellos encantados si te meas en la pila del agua. No te borran del registro, te denuncian, te meten a la cÃ¡rcel y ahÃ­ con un funcionario capellÃ¡n, pagado de tus impuestos, te van a estar dando la turra sin posibilidad de defenderte.
Y no cambiarÃ­an ni el agua de la pila
[#2](c2#c-2) Me parece estupendo, pero no creo que tenga consecuencias reales.
Lo que hay que hacer es no darles ni un cÃ©ntimo, ni a nivel particular, ni desde el gobierno, aunque esto es bastante difÃ­cil hoy por hoy.
Y hacer proselitismo del ateÃ­smo como si fuera otra religiÃ³n, que mucha gente simplemente pasa.
De toda maneras, tienen tal capital inmobiliario, que es imposible dejarles en la ruina. Como suelo decir, se van a convertir en una multinacional inmobiliaria.
Este obispo es especialmente intenso en lo que al pecunio se refiere. Desde su entrada en el obispado estÃ¡ siempre en portadas locales y nunca por temas espirituales. Ha liquidado negocios solidarios que llevaban dÃ©cadas instituidos, ha desahuciado a comunidades religiosas, ha vendido propiedades a empresas del sector educativo privado de cierta tendencia...
Iglesia S.A. es como suelen llamar la engendro que preside.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' â€œIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,â€ wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilsonâ€™s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,â€ he said in his report. â€œTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.â€ Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. â€œAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldremâ€™s â€œnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Walker Lawson
title: Charlotte leaders weigh $100M affordable housing bond projects | wcnc.com
text:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. â€” Charlotte city leaders are weighing a series of affordable housing projects that could bring hundreds of new units to the Queen City, funded by a $100 million housing bond approved by voters last November.
At a meeting Monday night, city staff recommended approval for 13 proposed projects across Charlotte aimed at addressing the cityâ€™s growing need for affordable housing.
â€œThereâ€™s a significant need, and itâ€™s growing,â€ Kaedon Grinnell, chief program officer at Roof Above , said. â€œGood affordable housing creates spaces where folks are not experiencing financial burden but are also connected to social supports that allow them to thrive.â€
Roof Above is a nonprofit working to combat homelessness in Charlotte.
One such project is Barton South, a 140-unit affordable housing development planned along the Blue Line Extension. Located just half a mile from two grocery stores, the site is designed to provide easy access to transportation and essential services.
However, not every proposal received a green light. City staff did not recommend moving forward at this time with the Brooklyn Village redevelopment, which included a $13.5 million request â€” the largest in the history of the Housing Trust Fund.
Staff recommended deferring that project while alternative funding structures are explored. The proposal is expected to return to the city council in June.
Mark Jerrell, chair of the Mecklenburg County Commission, expressed both support for the project and concern about potential delays.
â€œI think this is the way we should engage with folks that are asking for public dollars,â€ Jerrell said. â€œBut we also know this is one of the biggest opportunities we have as it relates to affordable housing. So in those terms, we want to make sure we are producing the best deal for the community, and so I certainly respect moving in a cautious manner, we just donâ€™t want to let the caution impede progress.â€
City Council is expected to vote on the recommended projects on April 28.
Contact Walker Lawson at wlawson@wcnc.com or follow him on Facebook , X , Instagram and TikTok .
Close Ad

author: Xinhua
title: Italy's renewable energy production overtakes fossil fuel in first half 2024-Xinhua
text:
ROME, July 18 (Xinhua) -- Energy production from renewable sources overtook that from fossil fuels for the first time in Italy, power grid company Terna said in a statement on Thursday.
The latest data referred to the first half of 2024, in which 43.8 percent of Italy's energy demand was fulfilled by renewable sources, compared to 34.9 percent in the same period of 2023.
Terna is a public company that owns over 99 percent of Italy's electricity transmission grid, according to its latest report.
Overall, energy generated from green sources increased by 27.3 percent between January and June against the first six months of 2023, while production from fossil sources dropped by 19 percent.
Renewable hydroelectric production (among green sources) grew by 64.8 percent in the period, while Italy's coal-based production of energy dropped significantly by 77.3 percent.
In June, electricity consumption grew by 1.5 percent against June 2023, and renewable sources fed 52.5 percent of the overall demand against 43.8 percent last year.
June was also marked by an increase in hydroelectric power (+29.4 percent) -- mainly due to the contribution of power plants in northern Italy -- in wind power (+29.2 percent) and solar power (+18.2 percent), data showed.
Italy plans to cover 39.4 percent of its gross energy consumption with renewable energy sources by 2030, the government said in its National Energy and Climate Plan (NECP) in June. â–

author: Nicole Lampert For Weekend Magazine
title: Nicholas Winton, the 'British Schindler': How the unassuming stockbroker who saved 669 Jewish children from the Nazis is the subject of a new film with Anthony Hopkins | Daily Mail Online
text: When Vera Schaufeld was nine in 1939, her mother took her to a park near their home in Prague and told her she was going on a train with other children to a country called England where she'd be looked after by kind people. A tearful Vera was told her parents would hopefully join her later, but she had to go now because Czechoslovakia was dangerous for Jews. That reunion never happened. For a few months Vera's family would speak by phone to Leonard and Nancy Faires, her new guardians in Bury St Edmunds. 'I could barely talk to my parents because I was crying so much,' recalls Vera. One day the calls stopped when they were sent to concentration camps and murdered. After the war, Vera became determined simply to help people as she'd been helped. After meeting her husband Avram, an Auschwitz survivor, she became a teacher specialising in giving English lessons to refugee children. Johnny Flynn as the younger Nicholas, a British stockbroker who came to save the lives of 669 German-Jewish children from the Nazis via the Kindertransport programme Vera hadn't really thought about how she had arrived in England as part of the Kindertransport programme, or who had been behind it, until her husband heard a news report on the radio appealing for people who had been brought from Czechoslovakia by train as children. 'I rang them and discovered I'd been brought over here by Nicholas Winton. I then ended up on That's Life, meeting Nicholas and all the other children,' says Vera. The incredible story of how Nicholas saved 669 children was first made public in 1988 when Esther Rantzen and the That's Life team tracked down Kindertransport children and their descendants to be part of the audience with an unsuspecting Nicholas. Now it's been made into a film called One Life starring Johnny Flynn and Anthony Hopkins as the younger and older Nicholas, dubbed the 'British Schindler'. Told over two timelines covering his exploits in 1939 and the That's Life revelations in 1988, the film is based on a book by Nicholas's daughter Barbara. It was her mother Grete who had first come across an old scrapbook in their attic, detailing many of the children Nicholas had helped. She spoke to a Jewish historian who passed the story on to a newspaper, which is when That's Life looked into it. Nicholas was a stockbroker born to German-Jewish parents who'd emigrated to Britain. When the Nazis took over the Sudetenland in Czechoslovakia in 1938, a friend of his persuaded him to go to see the dire situation the mainly Jewish refugees from Germany found themselves in. He was shocked by what he saw and realised there was nowhere for most of these refugees to go. The Kindertransport scheme for German-Jewish children had already been set up by a group of churches, humanitarians and British Jews. Anthony Hopkins plays the older Nicolas while Helena Bonham Carter plays Nicholas's mother Babette, who helped raise the Â£50 per child the government insisted on for their upkeep Nicholas knew that separating the children from their parents (who mainly couldn't get visas) and sending them on trains to Britain would be their best hope for survival, so he made a list of children needing rescue and set about finding homes and sponsors for them. The film tells Nicholas's story and those of some of the children, as well as those of fellow Britons who risked everything to help him. Helena Bonham Carter plays Nicholas's indomitable mother Babette, who helped raise the Â£50 per child the government insisted on for their upkeep. It was Nicholas's daughter Barbara who wanted Anthony Hopkins to play the older version of her father. 'She felt he has the same presence,' says Laurence Watson, the now late Barbara's son. 'My sister Holly and I were extras in the film, and seeing him dressed as my grandfather took us straight back to being with him. The real Nicholas Winton with one of the children he saved 'Anthony also brought home his mischievousness. My grandfather was a serious person but also really enjoyed life. That comes through in the film.' As the movie shows, there were actually two That's Life sessions with Nicholas. In the first, Esther Rantzen surprised him in the audience with the scrapbook and then revealed some other audience members were Kindertransport children. In a follow-up show a tearful Nicholas realised the entire audience was made up of either Kindertransport children or their descendants, and Laurence and Holly were among those who took part in the reconstruction of that famous moment. In fact, most of the audience in the film are real-life descendants of those saved by Nicholas and filming the scenes was emotional for everyone. 'It was like a kick in the chest when all the descendants came in,' recalls Anthony Hopkins. 'It was very moving.' Lady Milena Grenfell-Baines was sitting next to Nicholas at the first That's Life show. She was on the last train out of Prague in July 1939. There was meant to be one more but war broke out as it was leaving the station and the children never made it out of Prague. Most are believed to have perished, which is said to have haunted Nicholas. Lady Milena recalls that first meeting in the studio. 'What do you say to a man who saved your life? Simply thank you.' The That's Life team then managed to find scores of others who'd been on the trains for a follow-up a few nights later. Many had lost their entire families but found a new family within the group known as 'Nicky's Children'. Today there are some 6,000 people alive thanks to Nicholas and his colleagues. For Laurence, Nicky's Children became a sort of extended family. 'He loved to bring them together for his birthday parties â€“ he was a very good organiser and I think that's what made him so effective. I think they helped keep him going â€“ he lived until he was 106. 'Nicky was an ordinary person who did an extraordinary thing â€“ and I hope people will be moved by the story to make a positive change in the world.'

author: Par Laurent
title: Une tasse par jour Ã©loigne le psychiatre pour toujours
text: Une tasse par jour Ã©loigne le psychiatre pour toujours La dÃ©pression touche des millions de personnes dans le monde, avec des causes variÃ©es allant du stress Ã  la perte d'un Ãªtre cher. Bien que les mÃ©dicaments soient couramment prescrits, de nombreuses personnes recherchent des alternatives naturelles pour Ã©viter les effets secondaires. Une solution prometteuse Ã©merge sous la forme d'une boisson quotidienne, accompagnÃ©e de quelques habitudes de vie, qui pourrait rÃ©volutionner la lutte contre la dÃ©pression. Le thÃ© vert, un Ã©lixir anti-dÃ©presseur naturel qui booste le cerveau Le thÃ© vert, deuxiÃ¨me boisson la plus consommÃ©e au monde aprÃ¨s l'eau, recÃ¨le des propriÃ©tÃ©s Ã©tonnantes pour combattre la dÃ©pression. Des Ã©tudes ont dÃ©montrÃ© qu'une consommation rÃ©guliÃ¨re peut rÃ©duire significativement les symptÃ´mes dÃ©pressifs : - Boire 3 tasses par semaine diminue la dÃ©pression de 21% - Passer Ã  4 tasses par jour augmente cette rÃ©duction Ã  51% Ce pouvoir anti-dÃ©presseur s'explique par la richesse du thÃ© vert en composÃ©s bioactifs. Non fermentÃ©, contrairement au thÃ© noir, il prÃ©serve ses prÃ©cieux nutriments qui agissent sur plusieurs zones du cerveau : - Le cortex prÃ©frontal, impliquÃ© dans la rÃ©gulation des Ã©motions - Le noyau accumbens, liÃ© aux addictions - L'hippocampe, crucial pour la mÃ©moire et l'apprentissage L'un des composÃ©s phares du thÃ© vert est la L-thÃ©anine, un acide aminÃ© aux multiples bienfaits : - Stabilisation de l'humeur - AmÃ©lioration du sommeil - RÃ©duction du stress - Stimulation de la neurogenÃ¨se (formation de nouveaux neurones) Le thÃ© vert "dompte" le cortisol, l'hormone du stress qui favorise la dÃ©pression L'un des atouts majeurs du thÃ© vert rÃ©side dans sa capacitÃ© Ã  rÃ©guler le cortisol, l'hormone du stress. En tant qu'adaptogÃ¨ne, il aide l'organisme Ã  mieux gÃ©rer les situations stressantes, rÃ©duisant ainsi les risques de dÃ©pression. Cette action sur le cortisol explique pourquoi de nombreuses personnes se tournent vers le thÃ© vert pour gÃ©rer leur stress quotidien. L'exercice physique, un antidÃ©presseur naturel aussi efficace que le Zoloft Pour optimiser les effets du thÃ© vert, l'exercice physique s'avÃ¨re Ãªtre un complÃ©ment idÃ©al. Une Ã©tude menÃ©e sur 156 adultes souffrant de dÃ©pression majeure a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© des rÃ©sultats surprenants : - AprÃ¨s 4 mois, l'exercice s'est montrÃ© aussi efficace que le Zoloft (un antidÃ©presseur courant) - AprÃ¨s 7 mois, seulement 30% du groupe pratiquant l'exercice souffrait encore de dÃ©pression, contre 52% dans le groupe sous mÃ©dicaments L'exercice le plus bÃ©nÃ©fique pour combattre la dÃ©pression et l'anxiÃ©tÃ© serait l'entraÃ®nement par intervalles Ã  haute intensitÃ© (HIIT). La clÃ© rÃ©side dans de courtes pÃ©riodes d'effort intense suivies de repos, par exemple : - 12 secondes de course intense - 4 minutes de repos - RÃ©pÃ©ter ce cycle plusieurs fois La vitamine D, l'alliÃ©e solaire contre les "blues" hivernaux La vitamine D joue un rÃ´le crucial dans la rÃ©gulation de l'humeur, expliquant en partie pourquoi de nombreuses personnes ressentent une baisse de moral pendant les mois d'hiver. Pour contrer ce phÃ©nomÃ¨ne, il est recommandÃ© de : - S'exposer au soleil rÃ©guliÃ¨rement, surtout en Ã©tÃ© - Prendre un complÃ©ment de vitamine D, avec une dose minimale de 20 000 UI par jour Le jeÃ»ne, une mÃ©thode surprenante qui a sauvÃ© un homme suicidaire Le jeÃ»ne Ã©merge comme une pratique aux effets inattendus sur la dÃ©pression. Une anecdote frappante illustre son potentiel : Un homme suicidaire, dÃ©cidÃ© Ã  en finir, s'est enfermÃ© dans sa chambre pour se laisser mourir de faim. Contre toute attente, au bout de trois jours sans manger ni boire, il a commencÃ© Ã  se sentir Ã©tonnamment bien. Cette expÃ©rience involontaire de jeÃ»ne a non seulement mis fin Ã  sa dÃ©pression, mais a Ã©galement transformÃ© sa vie : - Sa dÃ©pression a complÃ¨tement disparu - Son anxiÃ©tÃ© s'est envolÃ©e - Il a retrouvÃ© un emploi et une vie Ã©panouie Le jeÃ»ne semble activer des mÃ©canismes de survie dans le corps qui ont des effets bÃ©nÃ©fiques sur l'humeur et le bien-Ãªtre mental. Cette pratique, bien que prometteuse, doit Ãªtre abordÃ©e avec prudence et sous supervision mÃ©dicale.

author: T13
title: INTERACTIVO: Vota por la mejor "buena noticia" para Chile de 2023 | T13
text: Usualmente a los periodistas nos toca cubrir hechos negativos: desastres, asaltos y muertes son una parte del acontecer diario, pero a la hora de resumir el aÃ±o 2023, en T13.cl quisimos apelar a algunas de las noticias que nos generaron alegrÃ­a o, a lo menos, tranquilidad. Las buenas noticias, que les llaman. A continuaciÃ³n te presentamos un reporte de 10 de las mejores "buenas noticias" que nos tocÃ³ reportear durante el aÃ±o y te invitamos, al final del artÃ­culo, a votar por tu favorita. EncontrarÃ¡s en la lista algunos hechos que vienen desde el deporte y otros desde la economÃ­a o la cultura. Y Fiu, por supuesto. El dinosaurio que reescribe la historia "Gonkoken nanoi" es el nombre que recibiÃ³ un dinosaurio descubierto en nuestro paÃ­s y que viviÃ³ hace unos 72 millones de aÃ±os, especÃ­ficamente en la Patagonia Chilena. Esta especie se caracterizaba por tener pico de pato y por ciertas cualidades que no habÃ­an sido detectadas previamente en otros hadrosaurios: Las conclusiones de la Red PaleontolÃ³gica de la Universidad de Chile determinaron que [este ejemplar era parte de un linaje ancestral de esta familia](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/nacional/gonkoken-nanoi-nueva-especie-dinosaurio-pico-pato-descubierta-patagonia-chilena-17-6-2023), con caracterÃ­sticas menos evolucionadas que sus sucesores, como en la composiciÃ³n de algunos huesos. Pedrito Pascal para el mundo JosÃ© Pedro Balmaceda Pascal. Ese es el nombre del actual rostro de Chile en el extranjero. En medio del declive de la GeneraciÃ³n Dorada de futbolistas en cuanto a figuraciÃ³n pÃºblica, Pedro Pascal se ha transformado en el referente de nuestro paÃ­s y su fama explotÃ³ con su participaciÃ³n en "The Last of Us". Sus series son de las mÃ¡s pirateadas del aÃ±o y en diciembre fue reconocido por IMDb como el [actor mÃ¡s popular de 2023.](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/tendencias/la-estrella-mas-popular-2023-pedro-pascal-reconocido-por-imdb-8-12-2023) Las lluvias nos regalaron un alivio en plena megasequÃ­a La zona central viviÃ³ uno de los inviernos mÃ¡s lluviosos en 14 aÃ±os. Desde junio y hasta bien entrada la primavera, las precipitaciones abundaron en los principales valles, en lÃ­nea con lo [pronosticado por la presencia del FenÃ³meno de El NiÃ±o. ](https://www.t13.cl/videos/programas/el-tiempo-en-tus-manos/invierno-lluvioso-verano-incendios-tiempo-tus-manos-11-10-2023)En Santiago, el superÃ¡vit fue de un 8,6% en la estaciÃ³n de Quinta Normal: Si en un aÃ±o promedio el rÃ©gimen pluviomÃ©trico es de 286 milÃ­metros, a la fecha esa cifra va en 310.7 milÃ­metros. Sin embargo, hay un punto negativo. Aunque este panorama ayudÃ³ a aplacar los efectos de la megasequÃ­a que afecta a la zona hace una dÃ©cada, la cantidad de agua acumulada en pocos dÃ­as dejÃ³ a miles de damnificados por las inundaciones y desbordes de importantes rÃ­os, como el Mapocho, Maipo, Cachapoal y Tinguiririca. Conciertos para la historia: de Los Bunkers a The Cure El 2023 fue un aÃ±o marcado por los regresos y por el debut en nuestro paÃ­s de artistas consagrados a nivel mundial. En marzo y tras varios aÃ±os de espera, el canadiense Drake se presentÃ³ por primera vez en un escenario local, en Lollapalooza Chile. En el mismo mes, [Los Bunkers regresaron](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/tendencias/la-noche-chilena-bunkers-young-cister-penultima-jornada-vina-2024-8-11-2023) con histÃ³ricos conciertos en Santiago, ViÃ±a del Mar y ConcepciÃ³n. El segundo semestre en tanto, dio paso a la venida de grandes artistas anglo, como Pet Shop Boys, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Roger Waters, Blur, Pulp y los britÃ¡nicos de The Cure, que no visitaban territorio nacional hace mÃ¡s de una dÃ©cada. El Metro sigue creciendo El Metro de Santiago -elogiado internacionalmente por su estructura y funcionamiento- sigue creciendo. A lo largo de 2023 se inauguraron las extensiones que llevaron el sistema de transporte a lugares aislados como Quilicura, El Bosque y San Bernardo. Actualmente el Metro cuenta con 143 estaciones y [estÃ¡n en desarrollo las lÃ­neas 7 (Renca-Vitacura), 8 (Providencia-Puente Alto) y la 9](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/nacional/te-puede-servir/metro-santiago-sumo-cuatro-nuevas-estaciones-l2-asi-quedo-mapa-sus-seis-lineas-27-11), que llegarÃ¡ del centro a Puente Alto y pasarÃ¡ por La Pintana. La irrupciÃ³n de Fiu y el exitoso Santiago 2023 En octubre y despuÃ©s de una larga preparaciÃ³n, se inauguraron los Juegos Panamericanos de 2023, la fiesta deportiva mÃ¡s grande jamÃ¡s organizada por el paÃ­s. RÃ¡pidamente, [la mascota del evento, Fiu,](/etiqueta/fiu) se transformÃ³ en el gran protagonista. El pÃ¡jaro siete colores enamorÃ³ a chilenos y extranjeros con su carisma y recorriÃ³ todos los centros deportivos con sus pasos de baile que [encarnaron la unidad que generÃ³ Santiago 2023](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/panamericanos-2023/tendencias/atrapado-una-escalera-hasta-levantado-por-lucas-nervi-7-mejores-momentos-fiu-nm-8) hasta el Ãºltimo dÃ­a de los Parapanamericanos. En el Ã¡mbito estrictamente deportivo, el Team Chile consiguiÃ³ triunfos histÃ³ricos y terminÃ³ en el sexto lugar del medallero con 16 preseas de oro. Se modera el costo de la vida En el Ã¡mbito econÃ³mico, y tras los aÃ±os marcados por la pandemia, la inflaciÃ³n se moderÃ³ en el paÃ­s. En el aÃ±o 2022 el costo de la vida acumulÃ³ una variaciÃ³n anual de 12,5% y, aunque en tÃ©rminos generales el objetivo del Banco Central es que el IPC se mantenga en torno al 3%, la buena noticia es que ha ido cayendo y este aÃ±o se encamina a cerrar en un nÃºmero mucho mÃ¡s bajo. SegÃºn el Banco Central, en su Ãºltimo Informe de PolÃ­tica Monetaria, este 2023 terminarÃ­amos con una inflaciÃ³n de 4,5%. Celeste Viel en Miss Universo En noviembre se realizÃ³ el Miss Universo 2023 y a 36 aÃ±os del rotundo Ã©xito de Cecilia Bolocco, Chile volviÃ³ a tener figuraciÃ³n gracias a Celeste Viel. La hija de la ex Miss Chile, Paula Caballero y el periodista Felipe Viel fue poco a poco quemando etapas en la competencia y quedÃ³ dentro de las 20 finalistas, [un hito que el paÃ­s no conseguÃ­a hace 19 aÃ±os.](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/tendencias/impresionante-logro-celeste-viel-tras-su-paso-miss-universo-21-11-2023) El regreso de una Copa del Mundo en 2025 El 17 de diciembre de 2023 la ANFP fue notificada por la FIFA para la realizaciÃ³n del Mundial Sub 20 en Chile el aÃ±o 2025. La noticia fue recibida con alegrÃ­a en el fÃºtbol nacional, luego de que nuestro paÃ­s quedara al margen de la organizaciÃ³n del Mundial en 2030, en una candidatura junto a Argentina, Uruguay y Paraguay. [El torneo se realizarÃ¡ diez aÃ±os despuÃ©s del Ãºltimo campeonato FIFA](https://www.t13.cl/noticia/deportest13/mundial-sub-20-chile-2025-conoce-cracks-podrian-asistir-al-torneo-juvenil-18-12-2023) que organizÃ³ Chile, el Mundial Sub 17 en 2015, y podrÃ­a recibir a jÃ³venes promesas como el espaÃ±ol Lamine Yamal, el brasileÃ±o Endrick, el francÃ©s Warren ZaÃ¯re-Emery o el argentino Claudio Echeverri, entre muchos otros. La Memoria Infinita rumbo al Oscar Maite Alberdi lo volviÃ³ a hacer. Tras el Ã©xito internacional que obtuvo por "El agente topo", la chilena estrenÃ³ ["La Memoria Infinita"](/etiqueta/la-memoria-infinita), documental que relata la historia de la actriz Paulina Urrutia y el diagnÃ³stico de alzheimer de su esposo, el reconocido Augusto GÃ³ngora. El periodista muriÃ³ en mayo de 2023, pero su legado se mantendrÃ¡ en la historia cinematogrÃ¡fica del paÃ­s como una de las pelÃ­culas mÃ¡s vistas del aÃ±o y tambiÃ©n tiene una expectante posiciÃ³n de cara a una eventual nominaciÃ³n al premio Oscar.

author: world today news
title: Major Fire in Heerhugowaard: Building Completely Burned Out, NL Alert Issued
text:
A garage on Nijverheidsstraat in Heerhugowaard completely burned out this evening. The fire brigade tried to extinguish the fire, but could no longer save the building. Due to heavy smoke development, local residents received a NL Alert shortly after midnight.
video-caption">First images of major fire Heerhugowaard â€“ VLN
News
Initial images show flames shooting out of the roof of the company. The fire brigade is now allowing the building to burn out in a controlled manner and is trying to prevent the fire from spreading to adjacent buildings.
The fire may have spread more quickly because the wind is blowing very hard in the region, thanks to storm Gerrit.
The fire started around 10:30 p.m. The
police have cordoned off a large area around the building. The company is located close to the Heerhugowaard train station, but for the time being there appear to be no disruptions to the train connection.
The N242 runs on the other side of the company. Due to the smoke development, it was closed by the emergency services near Heerhugowaard. It is unclear for how long.
Local residents and people in the area have been warned with an NL Alert to stay away from the smoke. The smoke moves from Nijverheidsstraat over the area between Westerweg and Costerstraat. Anyone who is bothered by smoke at home should close windows and doors and switch off mechanical ventilation.
Measurements are taken to see exactly how far the smoke spreads.
The fire brigade has warned people not to approach the fire. They emphatically ask for space to be given to the emergency services.
It is currently unclear whether people were still present in the building when the fire broke out. It is also not yet known whether there have been any injuries.
